subject: Re: [junit] How should protected inherited method be tested?
msgSnippet: ... You will die a horrible death. Well, no, but I find when I put my tests in a package separate from my production code, I have to think more about my
messageBody:
David Jackman wrote:

> What bad thing will happen if the test code is in the same package as
> the classes being tested? I do this all the time; if there's a problem
> with this approach I'd like to know what it is.

You will die a horrible death.

Well, no, but I find when I put my tests in a package separate from my
production code, I have to think more about my production code's public
API, and that helps me design them better.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.ca
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
